Summary I thoroughly enjoy working on highly impactful software projects, contributing to open source software and collaborating with a global network of clients and developers. 
 
Currently, I am pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at the University of Waterloo with a research area in machine learning. I am also a Google North America Scholarship recipient. 
 
Key Accomplishments: 
 
Developing software that allows Peace Corps HQ to communicate malaria prevention messages to potentially over 3,000 Peace Corps Volunteers deployed across Sub-Saharan Africa. The software was presented to Peace Corps HQ located in Washington, D.C. 
 
Architected and implemented epidemiology software. Wrote over 20,000 lines of code from the ground up and towards a usable software product that was released to top global collaborators in the field and presented to the World Health Organization in Geneva, Switzerland. 
 
Took ownership of an open source software project developed during Google Summer of Code 2014 as the lead developer. Wrote over 10,000 lines of code and deployed the software to organizational administrators for testing. 
 
Co-authored a book chapter that was successfully published in Social Media Mining and Social Network Analysis: Emerging Research (Chapter 6) (ISBN 978-1-4666-2806-9). 
 
Technical Skills: 
 
C, C++, Python, Java, Perl, C#, HTML, jQuery, Bootstrap, Git, SQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Django, Django REST API, ASP.NET MVC, Catalyst MVC, Selenium, Vim, Linux, Shell Scripting, Algorithms, Data Structures, Algorithm Analysis, Object Oriented Design, Relational Databases, Version Control, Automated Testing. Summary Passion: When it comes to technology, I'm all about dynamic language runtimes, syntax, grammar, garbage collection, optimization algorithms, and learning more about each of these every day. I love this stuff. A close second would be highly parallelized programming, which I've had less production experience with, mostly based in CUDA, and to a lesser extent OpenCL. I dabble in Rust. 
 
When it comes to products, I'm all about the platform itself. Particularly developing the web platform every opportunity I get. 
 
Most people might know me from my work on the AngularJS frameworks. They've been enjoyable, and I've had a lot of fun building them. But in spite of this, I am not a "front-end" developer, see myself more as a builder of clients and technologies which power clients or applications, rather than a person who can hack together HTML and CSS in a clever and pretty way. You might need someone else for those neat animations and layouts.
